description.narrative:
Stakeholders' Impact:
Provision of long term funding to borrowers, which is scarce in Ghana. It is estimated that 77% of SMEs in Ghana currently do not have access to finance and private credit as a proportion of national GDP in Ghana is relatively low as compared to other large developing economies. With 25% of the senior loan targeted at climate smart businesses and 25% at women owned enterprises, these stakeholders will benefit from access to longer tenured facilities.
Environmental and Social Impact - Climate targets will not only create awareness and provide finance to an overlooked sector in the country, but it will assist in reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Market Impact Assessment
Inclusiveness: A women in banking focus is generally not prevalent in the Ghanaian banking sector and targeting a portion of the senior loan to women will incentivize the bank in reaching an underserved group. The project is also expected to have demonstration effects in the banking sector, whereby other market players consider introducing products geared to women owned enterprises.
